comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: The Blagoveshchensky (Annunciation) Bridge (Благовещенский мост; from 1855 to 1918 Nikolaevsky Bridge, Николаевский мост; from 1918 to 2007 called Lieutenant Schmidt Bridge, Мост Лейтенанта Шмидта) is the first permanent bridge built across the Neva River in Saint Petersburg, Russia. It connects Vasilievsky Island and the central part of the city (Admiralteysky Island)

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
trialsanderrors:

Thanks for the additional information on this bridge and all its names.  We will add more information to this record when we update.
